qas.question: Why are there too many hospital beds?

qas.question: Where is it the most difficult to find a family doctor?

rationalisation processes in the German health care system

plausible_answers.text: rural regions with increased need of health care provision because of overageing

qas.question: Where is it the most easy to find a family doctor?

context: Health care in Thuringia is currently undergoing a concentration process. Many smaller <b6_0>hospitals<b6_0/> in the rural towns are closing, whereas the <a0_0><b3_0>bigger ones in centres like Jena and Erfurt<b3_0/><a0_0/> get enlarged. Overall, there is an oversupply of hospital beds, caused by <a1_0><b4_0>rationalisation processes in the German health care system<b4_0/><a1_0/>, so that many smaller hospitals generate losses. On the other hand, there is a lack of family doctors, especially in <a2_0><b5_0>rural regions with increased need of health care provision because of overageing<b5_0/>.
